#JS Challenge

The goal of this challenge is to build a search interface based on the Coveo REST API.
Complete instructions: [Coveo Front End Challenge](https://github.com/coveo/js-challenge)

***

I've decided to use Angular 2 to take up the challenge.
Here's is the [final result](http://js-challenge-saq.heroku.com/)

***

##What are my goals with this challenge?

###Things I expect to learn
* [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
* [Angular 2](https://material.angular.io/)
* [Coveo REST Search API](https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/SearchREST/Invoking+the+REST+Search+API)
* [Heroku](https://www.heroku.com/)

###Things that I know but that need to be refreshed
* [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/)
* [GitHub](https://github.com/)

###Things that seems cool
* [Angular Material](https://material.angular.io/) - Material Design components for Angular 2 apps
* [Coveo JavaScript Search Framework](https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/JsSearchV1/JavaScript+Search+Framework+V1+Home)

***

##References used to reach my goals

### Angular 2
* [QuickStart guide](https://angular.io/docs/ts/latest/quickstart.html)
* [Tour of Heroes tutorial](https://angular.io/docs/ts/latest/tutorial/)
* [CodeSchool - Accelerating Through Angular 2](https://www.codeschool.com/courses/accelerating-through-angular-2)

###Coveo
* [JavaScript Search Framework packaging](https://www.npmjs.com/package/coveo-search-ui)
* [Coveo Query Syntax Reference](https://onlinehelp.coveo.com/en/ces/7.0/user/coveo_query_syntax_reference.htm)
* [Invoking the REST Search API](https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/SearchREST/Invoking+the+REST+Search+API)

### Angular Material
* [Getting Started Guide](https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/GETTING_STARTED.md)

### JavaScript
* [Observer Design Pattern](http://www.dofactory.com/javascript/observer-design-pattern)

***

## Pitfalls / Time consuming issues

### TypeScript
* I had to refresh my general knowledge regarding ES2015.
* I didn't have the reflex to type everything when coding JavaScript.

### Angular 2
* Troubles passing values between components (parents, childrens, and siblings).
* I wasn't familiar with the _Observer Design Pattern_ and I had to learn the basics if I wanted to use it over the _Promise Pattern_.
* I decided to upgrade Angular 2.0.0-rc.7 to Angular 2.0.0 final.
* I found many examples regarding Angular 2 but most them are for previous versions.
* I still have unresolved issues with _Routing_ to pass and use parameters with Coveo REST Search API

### Angular Material
* I still have unresolved issues for importing the library.

### Coveo REST Search API
* I had troubles moving from a GET to a POST request with Angular 2 and RxJS Observer.

### Coveo JavaScript Search Framework
* I had conflicts with my routing and the \q? parameters appended to my URL.

### Github
* I am used to work with SVN... configuring WebStorm was not hard but I had unexpected results. I have decided to use [GitHub Desktop](https://desktop.github.com/).

### Heroku
* I had issues for packaging my application with _package.json_ (dependencies vs devDependencies)
* Déploiement à partir de GitHub
* I had issues with the port used by [lite-server](https://github.com/johnpapa/lite-server). I had to create the config file _/bs-config.js_ at the root of my project.

`module.exports = {
    "port": process.env.PORT
};`

***

## Unit tests

I've decided to build small unit tests regarding the Coveo REST Search API and my challenge.
Here's is the [source code](https://github.com/lgcarrier/js-challenge-saq/tree/master/testing)

### Framework and libraries
* [Mocha](https://mochajs.org/) test framework
* [Chai](http://chaijs.com/) BDD / TDD assertion library
* [Nightmare](http://www.nightmarejs.org/) browser automation library

![Testing results](images/js-challenge-saq-test.png)
